adventure_overview: Citizenship is one of the four aims of Scouting America program.  For Tigers citizenship begins at home and their den.  They will explore how they can contribute to their home and community. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Play a game with your den, or family members, that has a set of rules.  Discuss why rules are important to the game you are playing.

activities.name: Card Game – Go Fish
activities.description: Play a game of Go Fish!

requirements.text: With your Tiger Adult Partner, choose a job that will help your team. Follow through by doing that job at least once.

activities.name: Tiger Flag Ceremony
activities.description: Participate in a  flag-raising   ceremony for your school.

activities.name: Tiger Greeter
activities.description: Tiger  den  serve as greeters for the pack  meeting.

activities.name: Tigers Help Clean Up
activities.description: Help set up and clean up for a pack  meeting.

requirements.text: Play a game that requires at least 2 teams with your den, or two other family members. Afterwards discuss what it means to be part of a team and what makes a good team member.

activities.name: Tiger Charades
activities.description: Play a game of charades with your  den.

activities.name: Tiger Volleyball
activities.description: Play a game of Tiger Volleyball.

activities.name: Tiger Wiffle Ball
activities.description: Play a game of wiffle ball with the  den.

activities.name: 10,000 for the Troops – Tiger
activities.description: Cub Scouts participate in a special nation-wide project to create holiday cards for military personnel.  Please have letters mailed to the Scouting America National Service Center by November 7, 2025 .

activities.name: Board Game Collection
activities.description: Collect game boards for a community center.

activities.name: Tiger Scouting for Food
activities.description: Participate in  your  Council-sponsored  Scouting for Food  event.
